My TRUST in Congress Act would ban lawmakers from buying, trading, or selling individual stocks while in office.

I want Congress to take concrete steps to avoid even the potential perception of self-dealing — and it is clear that thousands of Virginians share this sentiment.

1484257618050887681.text: “Restoring TRUST in Congress is a thoughtful and positive way to frame this measure. Respect for and trust in our governmental institutions needs to be reinforced now more than ever.” — Rob, Chesterfield

1484257616792625165.text: “It is a MASSIVE conflict of interest to allow trading while in office. Why it was ever allowed in the first place is beyond my understanding. Thank you for addressing this issue.” — Angela, Louisa

1484257615651782658.text: “I agree with Rep Spanberger on this important legislation. AND she has the exact right approach: rebuilding TRUST in our elected legislators!” — Edward, Orange

1484257614536003592.text: “I want to be sure my lawmakers are making decisions based on what is best for their constituents, not personal profit.” — Ned, Henrico

1484257613399396357.text: “Rep Spanberger hit the nail on the head: members of Congress have too much inside knowledge about legislation and how it affects markets and individual companies. Acting on this is the same as insider trading, which is prohibited by the SEC.” — Larry, Culpeper

1484222066467479557.text:

1379184986201452555.text: While military firefighters are exposed to unique dangers through their work that lead many to develop service-related illnesses, the VA doesn’t recognize the direct connection between military firefighting and certain diseases, like cancer, beyond one year following active duty.

1379184985140297728.text:
Following his service-related cancer diagnosis and VA-denied coverage, Mike Lecik fought to ensure that thousands of military firefighters received the proper care they earned in service to our country.

$280 million to support mental and behavioral health, prevent burnout among healthcare providers and public safety officers.

$80 million specifically for vulnerable children.

1377016161070632962.text:
$1.5 billion for comprehensive community mental health services.

$1.5 billion to prevent and treat substance abuse.

$420 million for certified community behavioral health clinics.

1375092621324992526.text: The #AmericanRescuePlan provides a historic increase in the Child Tax Credit — so that Virginia families will receive an extra boost as we accelerate the fight against this virus.

1375092620372893702.text:
A family of four making $90,000 per year with a child over 6 and a newly eligible child age 17 or older:

Will receive $9,100 — $5,600 in stimulus, a boost in the CTC of $1,000 plus $3,000 for the older child, minus the $500 credit for a dependent not receiving the CTC.

1375092619269783556.text:
A family of four making $105,000 per year with one child under 6 and one child age 6 or older:

Will receive $8,200 — direct stimulus payments of $5,600 and a boost in the CTC of $1,600 and $1,000, respectively.

1375092618317737985.text:
A married couple making $40,000 per year with one child age 6 or older:

Will receive $5,200 — $4,200 in direct stimulus payments plus a $1,000 boost in the CTC.

1375092616501551108.text:
A married couple making $40,000 per year with one child under the age of 6:

Will receive $5,800 — $4,200 in direct payments, plus a boost in the CTC of $1,600.

1375092615356514313.text:
The #AmericanRescuePlan includes a major expansion of the Child Tax Credit for Virginia parents — with payments beginning to arrive in July.

Examples 👇

1374839629610938380.text: I’m proud to stand alongside @RepFredUpton, @RepDeanPhillips, and @RobWittman in reintroducing this commonsense bipartisan, bicameral legislation — and I’d like to thank @SenAmyKlobuchar and @SenatorBraun for leading this effort in the U.S. Senate.

1374430637327749129.text: While we still must work to make improvements to the law, the #ACA helped make health insurance affordable for millions of Americans and paved the way for Medicaid expansion here in Virginia — and I'm proud to keep up the effort to lower healthcare costs.

1374430636224618510.text:
A 40-year-old couple with two kids making $103,000 per year:

Previously paid $1,594 per month in premiums — or 18.5 percent of their income.

Now they pay $731 — saving more than $10,000 per year.

1374430635163480066.text:
A 50-year-old couple with a 25-year-old adult child making $85,533 per year:

Previously paid $1,793 per month in premiums — or 25.15 percent of their income.

Now they pay $606 per month — a savings of more than $14,000 per year.

1374430634047721481.text:
A 60-year-old married couple making $67,800:

Previously paid $2,118 per month in health insurance premiums — or 37.48 percent of their income.

With the American Rescue Plan they pay $480 per month — saving nearly $20,000 per year.

1374430632982446089.text:
11 years ago today, the #ACA became law.

Now, the #AmericanRescuePlan lowers healthcare costs by capping insurance premiums at eight and a half percent of income for EVERY income level — saving many Virginia families thousands per year. #ProtectOurCare

1307042229593178114.text: Just this week, it was reported that there is a push to add Kenya to the list of countries where U.S. military action is justified under the 2001 #AUMF – potentially even for preemptive, offensive strikes. https://t.co/Nt1lukbddM

1307042227550593024.text: In considering an #AUMF, Congress is meant to thoroughly debate and explicitly authorize the parameters for the engagement of U.S. armed forces in conflict. 1277746630612135939.text: If there are problems in our healthcare system, we should fix them, no doubt about it. But there is nothing solutions-oriented about recklessly endangering Americans with pre-existing conditions, bringing back lifetime caps, or kicking young people off their parents' insurance.

1277746629622317056.text: Another example: a 50-year-old couple with a 25-year-old adult child making $85,533 per year currently pays $1,793 per month in premiums, or 25.15% of their income. Under this bill, they would pay $606 per month — a savings of $14,246 a year.

1277746628665978880.text: Under this bill, no middle class family would pay more than 8.5% of their income for a silver plan in the health insurance marketplace. For a 40-year-old couple with two kids in Henrico making $103,258 per year, that means monthly premiums would go from $1,594 to $731.

1253753909899931648.text: Of that $25 billion, $11 billion is specifically allocated to state and local governments for their testing efforts. In Virginia and across the country, local leaders are trying to ramp up their efforts to conduct widespread testing and contact tracing - these funds will help.

1253753908964589569.text: 2. $75 billion to reimburse hospitals and healthcare providers for coronavirus expenses, such as PPE or increased staffing. The new law also includes $25 billion specifically designated for COVID-19 testing efforts.

1253753908008230912.text: The idea behind targeting that funding is to ensure that rural businesses, minority-owned businesses, & other underserved businesses have greater access to PPP loans. This new law also allocates an extra $50 billion to the EIDL program – another vital tool for small businesses.

1253753906653466631.text: 1. $310 billion for small businesses in Central Virginia and across the country. This amount will go to several different programs, including PPP. Within the PPP chunk of money, $60 billion is specifically set aside small & mid-sized banks, credit unions, and CDFIs.

6. An additional $10 billion for @SBAgov’s disaster loan program through end of 2020. 

Those are the takeaways from this package. Do we need to continue working to strengthen & expand aid for everyday Americans? Absolutely, and I'm glad we got started with some key wins today.

1243603956762378240.text:
5. Creation of a new Paycheck Protection Program. It protects workers by offering small businesses loan forgiveness on @SBAgov loans for payroll costs, rent, utilities, mortgage interest, etc. 
AS LONG AS
They don't fire employees or cut their pay.

1243603955394977792.text: 4. $349 billion in low-interest, forgivable loans for any business with 500 or fewer employees (also available during a covered period for independent contractors, self-employed workers, and sole proprietors.)

1243603953838931969.text:
2. An additional $600 per week in emergency unemployment assistance to everyone currently receiving unemployment benefits. 
3. A new unemployment program for those not traditionally eligible, like the self-employed & gig-economy workers. Payments would continue through 7/31/2020.

1243603952907812865.text:
1. Direct payments of $1,200 to all Americans with individual incomes up to $75K (married couples with incomes up to $150K would get $2,400.) Additional $500 per child.

We must consider additional aid for working families moving forward, but this is a necessary first step.

1224429217443713029.text: 2. In our efforts to stop endless wars and reassert Congressional authority, it's important to remove outdated AUMFs from the law books & ensure they are not used to justify future military action that was not originally authorized by Congress.

1224429216533549057.text: – and I firmly believe that members of Congress should have to responsibly debate and put their vote on the record before making the most serious decision that is in our power to make.

1224429215422001154.text:
So why repeal it? 

The significance of repealing the 2002 #AUMF is two-fold.

1. The Constitution requires Congress to vote before sending Americans into conflict –

1224429214243467265.text:
1. The 2002 #AUMF was drafted 18 years ago to authorize action against Saddam Hussein’s Iraq. Much has changed, including the fall of his regime, and this AUMF is no longer required.

2. Repeal wouldn't impact our ongoing counterterrorism efforts, which fall under the 2001 AUMF.

1224429212930576384.text: Last week, I joined both House Republicans and Democrats in voting to repeal the 2002 #AUMF. There's been a lot of discussion around the AUMF, so here are a few more details (thread.) https://t.co/jxgR8d6hiF

1217939686984945665.text: “At a time of divisive, angry partisanship, the call to do right by our service members, their families and the Constitution is one that can and should unite us.” I’m proud to work together with both Democratic and Republican colleagues on this vital issue. https://t.co/NHnGofGGX1

1217873179311513600.text: Today, I introduced the Michael Lecik Military Firefighters Protection Act. Rooted in the advocacy of a Powhatan, #VA07 veteran, this bill would enable veteran military firefighters to be treated at VA facilities for diseases tied to their high-risk work. https://t.co/U2fn84Sc6h

1217873017101078530.text: I'm extremely proud to introduce this bipartisan bill in Mike's name, and take another step toward securing the health benefits that veteran military firefighters have earned. Thank you to @RepDonBacon for joining me on this important, bipartisan effort.

1217873015884648448.text: After bringing the issue to my attention, Mike and I worked together to craft the Michael Lecik Military Firefighters Protection Act. This bipartisan bill would provide veterans firefighters with the healthcare & retirement benefits they've earned through service.

1217873014248890368.text: After his diagnosis, Mike found that the VA doesn't recognize the link between military firefighting & certain diseases like cancer. This makes it very hard for veteran firefighters to get the treatment they need. Mike became a fierce advocate on this issue.

1217873013040918528.text: Military firefighters are exposed to unique dangers during their work, including intense exposure to burning carcinogens. After his service to our country ended, Mike was diagnosed with multiple myeloma - a type of cancer linked to his time in our armed forces.

1217873007961690113.text: Mike lives in Powhatan, #VA07 and like me, he's the proud parent of three girls. Mike served our nation as a military firefighter, deploying twice to the Middle East. He worked to defend & rescue our troops in truly harrowing, high-risk circumstances. https://t.co/YuQAx59vmE

1215060618819981312.text: #5G holds economic promise for many American communities, especially in rural areas, but it also brings increased risk of exploitation & espionage by the Chinese military and companies like Huawei. I'm proud to see my bipartisan Secure 5G and Beyond Act pass in the House today. https://t.co/lBEAbdazDD

1215043530114109440.text: #5G represents a new frontier in cybersecurity. With a comprehensive strategy, we can help Americans take advantage of the economic benefits this technology offers, while also protecting against foreign influence, interference, & aggression. https://t.co/6oCZTdtcNs

1215043529111744512.text: My bill addresses this threat by requiring a comprehensive strategy for protecting American families, companies, and government agencies from espionage. It also encourages new R&D to help achieve and maintain a competitive edge for the United States in #5G technology.

1215043528126058498.text: Officials in the U.S. and our security partners abroad have already warned that #5G technology could be exploited by the Chinese government to spy on Americans, monitor competitor companies, and support Chinese military operations.

1215043527069126658.text: Adopting #5G can bring tremendous economic opportunity to U.S. communities, especially in rural areas that depend on high-speed connections to tap into the 21st century economy. However, we must be proactive about combating the security risks that come with this technology.

1215043525781475328.text: As Chinese companies like ZTE and Huawei strengthen their control over the global #5G market, the threat of foreign influence, espionage, and interference in American wireless systems grows.

1215043524690923528.text: Today, both Republicans & Democrats in the House voted to pass my Secure #5G and Beyond Act by 413-3. I'm proud of the strong bipartisan support behind my bill, and I want to explain why it's so important to tackle the growing national security challenges posed by 5G networks. ⬇️

1215040376177856516.text: Close ties between the Chinese government & companies like Huawei could lead to #5G technology being used to spy on Americans, monitor U.S. companies, & support Chinese military operations. The House just passed my bill to protect against these growing security threats by 413-3! https://t.co/esSoZnH0nI

1203449104568766464.text: Only a few more days to apply for our DC paid internship program! We're looking for service-minded applicants who have a strong desire to support & strengthen our #VA07 communities. Instructions and details are posted on https://t.co/pjyPm9dcKP under the Internships tab!

1203320759327707136.text: Today, we remember the thousands of Americans who lost their lives in the attack on #PearlHarbor. Few days in U.S. history have revealed our national character with such clarity. Today, let's renew our commitment to respond to adversity with courage, compassion, and unity. https://t.co/xdopuBsxbN

1203313210356453377.text: 📣 #VA07, we have a town hall tomorrow afternoon! Reminder: we'll be at Chancellor Middle School in Spotsylvania from 12-1. https://t.co/f7Q6NUhZx2

1203057419322036224.text: Today, I met with @VP Pence and a bipartisan group of lawmakers to discuss the #USMCA. I was heartened by the clear commitment that the USTR, House negotiators, and White House share. As we work to get to 'Yes,' I'll continue advocating for #VA07's businesses, workers, and farms. https://t.co/0dep1WJjVV

1203053719165833216.text: The right to vote is the bedrock of our democratic system. Today, I was proud to help pass the Voting Rights Advancement Act to restore vital voter protections, renew faith in our electoral system, and defend each Virginian’s right to be heard. https://t.co/Wyuh51lzOp

1203045450292584449.text: To keep our regional economy strong, we need to make sure #VA07 students & workers can get the training they need to stay competitive. My bill would expand opportunity by lifting the constraint on using 529 savings for workforce training programs. https://t.co/zd1hxDrYUE

1203037954693832706.text: #VA07 families and students should be able to allocate their own 529 funds where they choose, whether that's a 4-year college or a short-term credentialing program. My bipartisan bill with @RobWittman provides more choice to students & works to strengthen our regional economy.

1203037952990994438.text:
Today, I introduced my bill to allow students & workers to use their 529 savings to pay for career training & credentialing programs. Thank you @RobWittman for joining me in this important workforce-development legislation! 
https://t.co/c8sdjP3dz4

1203026320738996224.text: THIS WEEKEND ⬇️ Don't forget to stop by if you'd like to ask a question, make your voice heard, or connect with our district team about a casework concern. I'm looking forward to another substantive conversation with my constituents! https://t.co/ofYJK828HZ
